intro: Galium gracile var. miltorrhizum, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its thin, wiry stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and stems are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
